Interface GinRummyPlayer

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleGinRummyPlayer
public interface GinRummyPlayer

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      void startGame​(int playerNum, int startingPlayerNum, Card[] cards)
      Inform player of 0-based player number (0/1), starting player number (0/1), and dealt cards
      Parameters:
      playerNum - player's 0-based player number (0/1)
      startingPlayerNum - starting player number (0/1)
      cards - dealt cards

    • willDrawFaceUpCard

      boolean willDrawFaceUpCard​(Card card)
      Return whether or not player will draw the given face-up card on the draw pile.
      Parameters:
      card - face-up card on the draw pile
      Returns:
      whether or not player will draw the given face-up card on the draw pile

    • reportDraw

      void reportDraw​(int playerNum, Card drawnCard)
      Report that the given player has drawn a given card and, if known, what the card is. If the card is unknown because it is drawn from the face-down draw pile, the drawnCard is null. Note that a player that returns false for willDrawFaceUpCard will learn of their face-down draw from this method.
      Parameters:
      playerNum - - player drawing a card
      drawnCard - - the card drawn or null, depending on whether the card is known to the player or not, respectively.

    • getDiscard

      Card getDiscard()
      Get the player's discarded card. If you took the top card from the discard pile, you must discard a different card. If this is not a card in the player's possession, the player forfeits the game.
      Returns:
      the player's chosen card for discarding

    • reportDiscard

      void reportDiscard​(int playerNum, Card discardedCard)
      Report that the given player has discarded a given card.
      Parameters:
      playerNum - the discarding player
      discardedCard - the card that was discarded

    • getFinalMelds

      java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Card>> getFinalMelds()
      At the end of each turn, this method is called and the player that cannot (or will not) end the round will return a null value. However, the first player to "knock" (that is, end the round), and then their opponent, will return an ArrayList of ArrayLists of melded cards. All other cards are counted as "deadwood", unless they can be laid off (added to) the knocking player's melds. When final melds have been reported for the other player, a player should return their final melds for the round.
      Returns:
      null if continuing play and opponent hasn't melded, or an ArrayList of ArrayLists of melded cards.

    • reportFinalMelds

      void reportFinalMelds​(int playerNum, java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Card>> melds)
      When an player has ended play and formed melds, the melds (and deadwood) are reported to both players.
      Parameters:
      playerNum - player that has revealed melds
      melds - an ArrayList of ArrayLists of melded cards with the last ArrayList (possibly empty) being deadwood.

    • reportScores

      void reportScores​(int[] scores)
      Report current player scores, indexed by 0-based player number.
      Parameters:
      scores - current player scores, indexed by 0-based player number

    • reportLayoff

      void reportLayoff​(int playerNum, Card layoffCard, java.util.ArrayList<Card> opponentMeld)
      Report layoff actions.
      Parameters:
      playerNum - player laying off cards
      layoffCard - card being laid off
      opponentMeld - the opponent meld that card is being added to

    • reportFinalHand

      void reportFinalHand​(int playerNum, java.util.ArrayList<Card> hand)
      Report the final hands of players.
      Parameters:
      playerNum - player of hand reported
      hand - complete hand of given player
